{@b Jumper.} Gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}. Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.
{@b Keen Senses.} Gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill and choose one sense (sight, smell, taste, temperature, or touch). You gain advantage on Perception rolls that utilize that sense.

{@b Kin of Mine.} Gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled when you make an {@skill Animal Handling} check. In addition, you have two creature types: humanoid and beast. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.
{@b Longstrider.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Natural Armor.} When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 12 + your Constitution or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
{@b Natural Talent.} Beasts of the earth, sky, and sea have talents as varied as their shapes. You gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.

{@b Natural Weapon.} You have a natural weapon that you are proficient in (this could be a bite, claw, quill, club tail, or other bestial feature). This natural weapon is a finesse weapon that deals {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} bludgeoning, piercing, poison, or slashing damage (your choice).
{@b Born From Waves.} You have a swim speed equivalent to your walking speed and can breathe in air and water.
{@b Regeneration.} Whenever you complete a short rest, you can roll one {@dice {@dice {@dice d6}}} if you expended any hit dice. Add the result to the total health you gain.

{@b Relentless.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use a reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

{@b Chameleon.} You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks if you have not moved during the current turn. In addition, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demihuman could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Age
entries: Panda mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Panda are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order.

entries.name: Size
entries: Panda are between 7 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Natural Healer
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine} skill.

entries.name: Between Worlds
entries: Panda are considered humanoids and beasts for the purpose of calculating effects which take into account creature type. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types. You also ignore the effects of difficult terrain while in heavily-forested terrain.

entries.name: Gourmand
entries: Panda are excellent cooks and brewers. You are proficient in the cook's utensils and brewer's supplies.

entries.name: Sagely Knowledge
entries: You can cast {@spell comprehend languages} as a ritual. This is not represented as innate spellcasting, but rather as a Panda's incredible knowledge that spans all languages. All Pandas are polyglot, pulling knowledge from the Tree of Life to aid in their everyday tasks. However, due to this vast amount of knowledge, it is difficult for them to recall all the languages kept in their mind's archive, leading to forgetfulness.
In addition, when casting {@spell comprehend languages} this way, you also learn to speak those languages for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aftuan are theoretically immortal, but subsist off their legends in ancient folktales and stories. In order to continue their furrowed existence, they must continue to spread their creeping fear. A fear that can only be described as the fear of the unknown.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Aftuan are connected directly to Chaos, but this does not mean they're chaotic. Instead, their ability to view things from all aspects as Chaos guides them allows the Aftuan to take a uniquely true neutral approach to the world.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aftuan are between 5 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes give you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, you only see in shades of blue.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries: Unnatural. Unconventional. As an aftuan, your existence is beyond this world's boundaries. Your creature type is aberrant, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits as per your aberrant nature:

items: You have resistance to psychic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.
You cannot suffer from the effects of madness.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Whispers in the Beyond
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell dissonant whispers} spell once per day. At 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell crown of madness} spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to other creatures within 60 feet. However, you can only speak Deep Speech this way, and creatures who don't speak Deep Speech can only make out distant, haunting whispers. The exception are creatures under the effects of Long-Term or Indefinite Madness, who can make out your words clearly, regardless of their known languages.

entries.name: Otherworldly Appendages
entries: Aftuan are birthed with four illithid tentactles that can manifest from any part of their body. Your additional appendages allow you to interact with an additional object or feature of the environment for free on your turn. You may not carry and use shields for defense with these additional appendages. Nor do they grant you additional attacks, or allow you to wield weapons with them for combat.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Deep Speech. In addition, you learn how to read Qualith.

entries.name: Age
entries: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan—typically a century or less. While a changeling can shapeshift to conceal their age, the effects of aging still catch up to them.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Changelings hate to be bound in any way, and those who follow the path of the Traveler believe that chaos and change are important aspects of life. Most tend toward pragmatic neutrality as opposed to being concerned with lofty ideals. Few changelings embrace evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: In their natural forms, changelings average between 5 and 6 feet in height, with a slender build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries: As an action, you can transform your appearance or revert to your natural form. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you revert to your natural form if you die.

You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, the sound of your voice, coloration, hair length, sex, and any other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this trait to become quadrupedal, for instance. Your clothing and other equipment don't change in appearance, size, or shape to match your new form, requiring you to keep a few extra outfits on hand to make the most compelling disguise possible.

Even to the most astute observers, your ruse is usually indiscernible. If you rouse suspicion, or if a wary creature suspects something is amiss, you have advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check you make to avoid detection.

entries.name: Changeling Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}

entries.name: Unsettling Visage
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divergent Persona
entries: You gain proficiency with one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice. Define a persona associated with that proficiency: establish the name, race, gender, age, and other details. While you are in the form of this persona, the related proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that proficiency.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: The Beneath live up to two hundred years after the time they ascended, sustained by the unholy powers that mutated them, before the dark energies fizzle out and the creature perishes.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The bloodlust that lives within all Beneath drives them toward evil, but the strong willed can maintain a neutral disposition. A rare, exceptional few can even become good.

entries.name: Size
entries: The Beneath are between 8 feet to 9 feet tall, although as a quadruped, their height can deminish to as low as 4 to 5 feet when running. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Ankheg's Tremorsense
entries: You have tremorsense up to 10 feet. As an action which lasts for one minute, you can extend your tremorsense to 40 feet. You can only use this feature twice per short rest.

entries.name: Arctic Regeneration
entries: Whenever you complete a short rest, you can roll one {@dice {@dice {@dice d6}}} for each hit die you expend. Add the result to the total health you gain.

entries.name: Umber Hulk's Burrowing
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend up to your current movement speed to burrow underground, traveling to a destination within range. While you are burrowing, you are considered to be under the effects of full-cover. After using this feature, you decide whether you'll emerge on the current turn, or the turn after you start to burrow.
Regardless of when you arrive at your destination, you cannot use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Monstrous
entries: Your creature type is monstrosity, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Deadly Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start. If you jump at least 15 feet as part of your movement, you can use an attack action to slam on the ground in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, those creatures are knocked {@condition prone} and take {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} bludgeoning damage. This damage increases to {@dice {@dice 2d6}} at 5th level, {@dice {@dice 3d6}} at 10th level, {@dice {@dice 4d6}} at 15th level, and {@dice {@dice 5d6}} at 20th level. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Terran.

entries.name: Age
entries: Saki live long lives. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live to be about two centuries.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Saki society, with its clear roles and tasks, has a strong lawful bent. The Saki's sense of fairness, balanced with a strict code of conduct, leans them more towards good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Saki are between 7 and 9 feet tall and weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Hearty Fortitude
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Rock Hurler
entries: You are considered proficient in the use of appropriately-sized rocks and boulders as ranged weapons. Such boulders typically weigh fifty pounds, and deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d10}}} + your Strength modifier, and have the thrown (30/150) and heavy qualities. These boulders are also considered simple melee weapons.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You’re acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You’re also naturally adapted to cold climates, and have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Door Opener
entries: You learn the {@spell mold earth} cantrip, and are skilled at using it to modify doorways to allow for your larger build. You can repair the doorway afterward without expending an action.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Dusk Study
entries: Scholars have hardened their minds to resist the calls of slumber. While taking a long rest, you can spend half of that time doing any studious activity, including reading and writing.

entries.name: Path of Knowledge
entries: When attempting to recall information about a particular city, kingdom, or culture, you are considered proficient in History, and add double your proficiency to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one additional language.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: War Born
entries: You gain proficiency in two martial weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Savage Dissonance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, before you fall unconscious, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against a creature within melee range. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Cook at the Hill
entries: You gain proficiency with cook’s utensils.

entries.name: Exotic Ingredients
entries: Whenever you prepare a meal for your party, provided you have cook’s utensils and other supplies on hand, you can use a variety of strange ingredients.

entries.name: Keen Nose
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: As Hard as His Axe
entries: As an Executioner, you've seen it all, and you don't care. You no longer feel non-magical fear.

entries.name: Exotic Weaponry
entries: You are proficient in the use of nets.

entries.name: It's Me or You
entries: You loathe to let a criminal escape your grasp. Whenever you would make an attack of opportunity, you can gain advantage on that attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divine Prophet
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Religion}.

entries.name: Blood of Alu'kuri
entries: Your Rock Hurler now allows you to use boulders over one hundred pounds as ranged weapons. You deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d12}}} + your Strength modifier. Boulders below a hundred pounds do not gain the benefit of this trait.

entries.name: Choba Choba
entries: You can tap into your divine sense to see future events once per long rest. These visions can be sporadic, and typically have little context.

entries.name: Hands of Alu'kuri
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. When used, it appears as a long, mechanical red hand, symbolic of the blood-soaked weapon that Alu'kuri has become in the eyes of the lowlanders.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ghosts do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Ghosts cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being reborn as a ghastly entity on the mortal coil changes them significantly, and they adopt a new worldview in light of what their transformation has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being transformed in the Ethereal Plane, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back to the mortal coil, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Holy Gospel
entries: After reviving in the Material Plane, you received a blessing through a deitic force. This force is not any specific deity or person, but rather a force of nature similar to a tornado or hurricane. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Otherworldly Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet and can hover. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.
If you do not attune to the Way of Worlds, you can still fly using this feature. However, your maximum height is 5 feet. While flying this way, you can still hover.

entries.name: Deitic Force
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice {@dice 1d10}} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. After passing through a physical barrier, you must complete a short or long rest before you are able to do so again.

entries.name: Intangible
entries: You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Invoke Smite
entries: You can instill power into the weapon of a nearby creature to strike with divine energy. As an action, a creature within 30 feet of you.

Until the end of your next turn, the next time that creature succeeds on a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d8}}} radiant damage or {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d8}}} necrotic damage (your choice). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spirit Binding
entries: As a Spirit, your ghastly form is not completely realized, and require an anchor to maintain your existence in the Material Plane. You must select an object or creature of your choice (it could be a heirloom, weapon, or ally) to bind to indefinitely.
• You must remain within 150 feet of your bound target at all times, and if the object leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it.
• You are always aware of where your bound target is in relation to you.
• Should the object be destroyed or the creature slain, you immediately drop to 0 hit points.

• If you regain consciousness without a spirit bond, you must immediately select a new object or creature within 150 feet to bind to. If no items or creatures are present within 150 feet, you are paralyzed until one comes within 150 feet of you.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice {@dice 1d10}} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. After passing through a physical barrier, you must complete a short or long rest before you are able to do so again.

entries.name: Ethereal Glare
entries: As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. This creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. If it fails, this creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Canopic Chamber
entries: Chained to your soul is your physical body, which lies dormant in a sacrophagus until the time of your True Resurrection. This sacrophagus is located on the Ethereal Plane, and follows you within a 50 foot radius as you move along the Material Plane. Your body remaining alive is what allows your soul to reflect against the Material Plane as a humanoid shell for your actions.

If at any point your real body is destroyed, with the result making it so you are unable to sustain your continued existence, you soul immediately vanishes from the Material Plane. Following that, you immediately take Aeon damage equal to your maximum hit points (including temporary hit points), and your cease to remain within the collective conscious of humanity.

During a period of one hundred years after this event, memories of your existence will slowly begin to disappear from the minds of even your closest comrades, until eventually your life is completely wiped from annals of all non-magical storage.
• Your sacrophagus is bound to the Ethereal Plane by a deitic force and cannot be moved to a separate plane by any means.
• Your sacrophagus is locked shut by ethereal chains, although they can be opened with a DC 25 thieves' tools check.
• If your sacrophagus is unlocked, taking a short rest will relock it. This is represented by the ethereal chains needing time to reform.
• Your sacrophagus has an AC of 18 and hit points equal to a quarter of your maximum hit points.
• Any saving throws your true body or your sacrophagus makes are flat {@dice {@dice 1d20}}s.
• Your true body has an AC equal to 10 and hit points equal to your current maximum.
• Spells such as True Resurrection and Clone can only be cast on the body within your sacrophagus, and not your soul on the Material Plane.
• Your body within the sacrophagus is unconscious, but it is also immune to the following conditions: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained.
• No matter what plane you are on, you are aware if your true body is being attacked (but not if your sacrophagus is).
• Your true body cannot be separated from your sarcophagus.

entries.name: Canopic Resurrection
entries: While your soul is reflected against the Material Plane, your actual body resides on the Ethereal Plane. While your body remains safe and within its sarcophagus, you can reroll one death saving throw you have made. If you roll a 17 or higher on this rerolled saving throw, treat the result as if it was a natural 20. Once you reroll this saving throw, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

entries.name: Grasp from Beyond
entries: You can choose to make your unarmed strike deal force damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and any creature hit by your unarmed strike is unable to regain hit points until the end of your next turn. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by your unarmed strike, it instantly disintegrates into soul fumes, leaving behind any objects, clothing, or items on its person.

entries.name: Age
entries: Like other fungi, myconids reproduce by mundane sporing. They carefully control their spores' release to avoid overpopulation. Individual myconids can live to well over a century. After this time, the most elder myconids can live even longer, becoming a Soverign of one or more circles and living up to a century longer.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most often, myconids believe strongly in society and law. It is extremely uncommon for a myconid to directly harm any creature that does not mean it, or its circle, harm. They are an incredibly passive and peaceful species.

entries.name: Size
entries: Myconids are between 5 feet to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Fungi
entries: Your creature type is plant, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries: You become {@condition Poisoned} if you spend more than 1 minute in direct sunlight. This condition ends when you spend at least 1 minute in dim or dark conditions.

entries.name: Without a Voice
entries: Myconids lack proper biological constructs that can convey sound, and as such, they cannot speak language or interact verbally with other creatures. Though you have no conventional way to verbalize your thoughts, you may still cast spells that require verbal components.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries: Your spores can relay messages to you and to allies by sensing the synapses in a creature's mind. You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

You can extend this benefit to a creature or multiple creatures as an action, allowing them to converse telepathically with you or with each other for a range of 15 feet. The creatures selected must have an Intelligence score of 2 or higher. Once the telepathic network is set up, said creatures do not need to share a language in order for them to understand each other's telepathic utterances, but they each must be able to understand at least one language.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: As an action, you can ejects spores at one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Charmed} for 1 minute. Undead, constructs, and elementals are unaffected by these spores. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After using this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: As an action, you can produce spores that effect all creatures within 30 feet of you that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. You manifest the effects of the {@spell minor illusion} spell on the targeted creatures while you concentrate on this ability. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Rejuvenating Spores
entries: As an action, you can disect the body of a deceased individual who died within the last hour in front of you taking that is not an undead, construct, or elemental. This process takes one minute and requires serene concentration, the completion of which produces a spore which you can give to yourself or an ally within 5 feet of you.

Upon receiving a spore, the creature receives {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d10}}} temporary hit points, and the body you were disecting decays into a fine yellow powder. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a long rest.

entries.name: Meld
entries: When you take a short or long rest in the presence of one or more other myconids, you can meld with them. After melding, you regain all expended Hit Dice and gain one of the following benefits:
• You gain advantage on the next saving throw you make.
• You can end one effect causing you to be {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, or {@condition Poisoned}.
• You can roll an additional {@dice {@dice 1d4}} and add the number rolled to one ability check or attack roll you make.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can read and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sacara mature at the same rate as humans and live for up to 200 years. Female Sacara shed their young tails at age 15 in order to grow into their adult tails, and all Sacara from 20 and onwards shed every 5 years, maintaining their ageless youth.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sacara have a tendency to the neutral and evil spectrum of the alignment tree, as their society is largely built around the principle of individual strength, so concepts like good seminarianism are less prominent. Their scheming nature incline many Sacara toward a lawful alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sacara maintain the same size and build as humans, although female Sacara manifest a serpentine body from the navel down. Their snake-like tails can extend anywhere from 5 to 9 feet long. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Viper's Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to your bestial nature, you have superior vision in dark and dim lit places. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in the darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in the darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: Once you reach 5th level, you learn the spell {@spell hold person}. You can cast this spell once per long rest, as your paralyzing schlera are scratched and need time to regenerate. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries.name: Serpent's Sting
entries: You gain the benefits of Serpent's Sting in one of three situations:
• At the start of your turn, if another creature is currently {@condition Grappled} by you.
• At the start of your turn, if another creature is currently grappling you.
• During your turn, when you successfully grapple another creature.

If you meet either of these conditions, you may use your serpentine hair to deliver a bite attack. This is a free action, and you may only target the creature you are grappling or being grappled by. You may only use Serpent's Sting once per turn, regardless of how many creatures you are grappling or are grappled by.

You are considered proficient in this bite attack, which deals piercing damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier. This damage increases to {@dice {@dice 2d6}} at 5th level. {@dice {@dice 3d6}} at 10th level, {@dice {@dice 4d6}} at 15th level, and {@dice {@dice 5d6}} at 20th level.

entries.name: Acidic Lungs
entries: You know the {@spell acid splash} cantrip. Your spellcasting modifier for this spell is Intelligence.

entries.name: Slithering Path
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Abyssal, and Draconic.

entries.name: The Art of Intelligence
entries: Choose two tools from the following list: {@item Carpenter's tools|phb}, {@item Mason's tools|phb}, {@item Cobbler's tools|phb}, {@item Painter's tools|phb}, {@item Weaver's tools|phb}, {@item Glassblower's tools|phb}, or {@item Potter's tools|phb}. You gain proficiency in those tools, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with them.

entries.name: Serpent's Ward
entries: Once per long rest, one of your snakes can inject you or a creature within 5-feet of you with a special poison. Instead of harming the individual, this poison seeks to establish antibodies in the body of the individual to increase their resistances. When you use this feature, you choose one effect from the list of variations below:
{@bold Acid Ward}. The creature gains resistance to acid for one minute.
{@bold Poison Ward}. The creature gains resistance to poison for one minute.
{@bold Antivenom}. The creature is cured of the {@condition poisoned} condition and gains advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.

entries.name: Master of High Places
entries: You gain a climb speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Abyssal, and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Fey mature at the same rate as humans, but are considered young until they reach the age of 100. On average, they live about 700 years. Archefaeries are unique in this regard—so long as their blessing is continually maintained by their guardian contractor, they live indefinitely. However, true immortality is rare, as extended time spent in human civilizations generally will erode an archfaerie's mind, disconnecting them from the wild and their guardian contractor forever. An archfaerie with a weak will needs to regularly return to the Feywild; otherwise, they generally survive for a maximum of 200 years in a human settlement.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fey delight in living a life free of the mantle of law. They gravitate toward being good, but some have devious streaks and enjoy causing dismay.

entries.name: Size
entries: Fey range from just under 5 feet to about 6 feet in height, with generally slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: The Great Summer Court
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Ram
entries: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Reveler
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

entries.name: Mirthful Leaps
entries: Whenever you make a long or high jump, you can roll a {@dice {@dice d8}} and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

entries.name: Magical Luck
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Charisma, and Dexterity saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Piper & the Goat
entries: You gain proficiency with panpipes, which you can use to play a variety of melodies that instill magical effects by manifesting the nature of the Feywild. The DC for these melodies are equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. Once you use any of these features, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

{@bold Melody of Charm}. As an action, you play a dizzying and enchanting tune to a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to your melody save DC. On a failed save, that creature becomes {@condition charmed} for one minute. Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this melody.

{@bold Melody of Galloping}. As an action, you play a chipper and upbeat tune as you gain a skip in your step and feel a blossoming freedom in your chest. Your movement speed increases by 10 for one minute.

{@bold Melody of Slumber}. As an action, you play a gentle and soft tune to a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to your melody save DC. On a failed save, that creature descends into a deep slumber as it falls {@condition unconscious} until one minute passes, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this melody.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Ram
entries: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to your starlight eyes, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of blue.

entries.name: Body of Dreams
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition petrified}.

entries.name: Gift of the Naaru
entries: You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell augury} spell once per day and the {@spell aid} spell once per day. Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.

entries.name: Planar Trance
entries: Draenei don't need to sleep. Instead, they materialize their astral forms in the plane of dreams, remaining semiconscious of their material forms. This trance needs to happen at least 4 hours a day. While observing the dream plane, you can manifest your own dream, allowing you to be effected by magic such as the {@spell dream} spell. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and Quori.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 35 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: Nimble Trickster
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Tricker's Mirage
entries: One of the Summer Queen's many gifts was a blessing reminiscent of the playful pixies—a skill which allows you to immerse your body in the nature of world and become impossible to detect by mortal eyes. As an action, you become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn, or until you attack or cast a spell that targets another creature.
You can use this ability twice, and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

entries.name: Blessings of Autumn Wind
entries: You have advantage on all Dexterity, Intelligence, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Gift of the Summer Queen
entries: You learn the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Heart Sight
entries: Your connection to the Feywild has allowed you to retrieve the hearts of mortals and distill their personalities onto a matrix, to which you can uncover their true sense of being. As a bonus action, you can target one creature within 60 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw equal to your save DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier).

On a failed save, you learn that creature's emotional state, and whether they are inflicted by any conditions or diseases. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 35ft. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item. This flight is not affected by Antimagic fields.

entries.name: Amongst Giants
entries: Tiny creatures have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, but disadvantage on Strength saving throws. In addition, tiny creatures can move into the spaces of creatures that are small or larger, provoking opportunity attacks as normal. They have a reach of 0 feet, meaning they must be in the same space as a creature to use a weapon or touch spell. This feature does not take effect if you are not currently considered Tiny.

entries.name: Pixie Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Druidcraft}, {@spell Mending}, and {@spell Faerie Fire} spells. You can cast {@spell Faerie Fire} without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is your choice of Intelligence, or Charisma.

entries.name: Wrath of the Wee fey
entries: Your Pixie upbringing makes you more martial than most and as such you have some training with weapons. You have proficiency with Shortbows, Shortswords, Hand Crossbows, Sickle, Slings, Pikes, and Shields. These weapons are specially made and must be properly sized for you due to your size.

entries.name: Pixie Dust
entries: If you are standing in an allied creatures space, you can use a bonus action to give them temporary flight. This flight lasts two rounds and grants a flying speed equal to the creatures walking speed. This ability can only be used up to your Constitution Modifier. This Ability recharges on a long rest.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Fey Passage
entries: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Common, Sylvan, and one other of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dragonkin mature at the same rate as humans, but after age 18, they visibly age at a span of 1 year for every 5. On average, they live about 500 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dragonkin tend towards an alignment based on their draconic ancestery, but they hold the same initiative as most humans. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonkin vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Dragon Marked
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and dragon. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Draconic Sense
entries: The dragon blood pumping through your veins allows you to see better than any normal human. As a bonus action, you can awaken these senses, becoming aware of any creatures within 120 feet of you. You know the locations of all creatures within that radius, regardless of whether they are invisible or hidden. This sense lasts for one round. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. You gain resistance to damage as determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Draconic Visage
entries: You exemplify both your pride and arrogance as a warrior, releasing an aura that threatens to send those weaker than you into epileptic shock. As an action, creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Charisma saving throw (DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, those creatures become {@condition frightened} for one minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Dragon's Pride
entries: A sun dragonkin's hallmark is their unwavering pride, and you showcase this to its fullest extent. You have advantage on saving throws to become {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Infernal, and Draconic.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. You gain resistance to damage and modifiers to movement as determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.caption: Draconic Ancestry
rows: {@bold Predator}. Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@bold Airborne}. You gain a climbing speed of 20 feet.
{@bold Explorer}. Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@bold Ice Walk}. Difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to your moonlit eyes, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of blue.

entries.name: Moon's Vigil
entries: Enhanced by lunar energies, a moon dragonkin has been blessed against unforeseen threats. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition petrified}, and have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and Draconic.

entries.name: Mixed Ancestry
entries: As a Darkseed, you were born with mixed blood. A feature which takes place in one of three forms. You gain an ability dependent on your primary coloration, as shown in the table.

entries.caption: Mixed Ancestry
rows: {@bold Solaris}. You do not suffer any ill effects from extreme heat.
{@bold Lunaris}. You do not suffer any ill effects from extreme cold.
{@bold Birthed from Prejudice}. Difficult terrain composed of rough cityscape and modern obstacles doesn't cost you extra movement.

entries.name: Force Swipe
entries: You can manifest astral claws from your fingertips, which are natural weapons with the concealed property that can be used to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal force damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} + your Dexterity modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: I Will Not Cower
entries: After years of facing fierce prejudice from full dragons and those with purer blood, you have grown a vendetta against cowering for fear of your life. You will take your destiny into your own hands. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, and a creature cannot gain the benefits of flanking against you while you are conscious.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: A Mousefolk reaches adulthood at the age of 5 and lives to be about 60 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Mousefolk are neutral, and tend towards good. They try to keep the conflicts of the other races at arm's length, but display remarkable ferocity when their friends, families, or communities are threatened. A reverence for nature and life is close to the heart of Mousefolk, and they are loath to take a life if it can be avoided. They prefer to live quiet and unassuming lives, giving honest work for honest pay.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mousefolk grow between 2 and 2 1/2 feet tall and weigh about 25 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Keen Eye
entries: You have proficiency in the Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) skill.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: You have proficiency with the rapier, shortsword, shortbow, and handaxe.

entries.name: Artistry
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument.

entries.name: Squirm
entries: You can move through tiny-sized spaces as if you were tiny.

entries.name: Nimble Sense
entries: When targeted with an attack of opportunity, you may use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Squeak Speak, and Halfling.

entries.name: Brave Heart
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Grace of the Small
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts.

entries.name: Invoke Gift
entries: You can instill power into the weapon of a nearby creature to enhance their blow with divine energy. As an action, a creature within 30 feet of you.

Until the end of your next turn, the next time that creature succeeds on a melee weapon attack, that creature heals for {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d10}}} hit points (if you are good or neutral) or gains {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d8}}} temporary hit points (if you are evil). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Squeak Speak, and Halfling.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size depends on the armor you inhabit, between that made for Small to Medium-sized creatures. Your size is Small or Medium.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: You are put under the effects of the {@spell slow} spell while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by dispel magic, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Construct
entries: You are a suit of armor made of a variety of durable materials. Your creature type is Construct. Spells like cure wounds don't affect you as you are a construct and you are immune to spells like crown of madness or dominate person due to them specifically targeting humanoids. You are immune to poison damage, being poisoned and diseases.

You do not need to eat or breathe, and any food you do attempt to eat falls through your space where your head would be at the bottom of your armor. Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.
When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on constructs, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

entries.name: Soul Transfer
entries: You can transfer your consciousness into another suit of armor over the course of a short or long rest. During that time you or another creature performs an hourlong ritual. Over the course of that hour, you must remain within 5 feet of the armor or the ritual fails. This change may alter your subrace accordingly, based on the desired armor’s type. If you are not proficient in the armor you transfer yourself into you receive all the detriments that someone normally would by wearing a set of armor they are not proficient in as well as an additional -2 to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Two Minds One Body
entries: Animated Armors don't usually allow other creatures to wear them. In dire times, however, they might do so to pass themselves off as regular armor. Animated armor can be worn by a creature one size category larger or smaller than the armor itself, if you are currently inhabiting magical armor. When an Animated Armor is worn by another creature, the creature gains the following benefits:
• Your wearer gains proficiency in your armor type.
• Your wearer's AC increases to the AC of your armor, plus any modifiers they have (if applicable).
• Your wearer is under the effects of the {@spell warding bond} spell, as if cast by you, for as long as they wear you.
• You can remove yourself forcibly from your wearer with a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. Your wearer can choose to purposely fail this check.
• While you are being worn, you are unable to move or take actions, other than using an action to forcibly remove yourself from your wearer on your turn.

entries.name: Innate Light Armor
entries: The armor your soul inhabits is leather armor making your Armor Class 11 + your Dexterity modifier. If you use your Soul Transfer trait to transfer yourself to another piece of light armor then the formula for calculating your Armor Class becomes that of the armor you transfer yourself to. You are also affected by any other additional properties of the armor such as a Strength requirement, a disadvantage on Stealth checks, a bonus to your Armor Class or even a curse.

entries.name: Armor Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency with Padded and Leather armor. While you use either of these options, you may treat yourself as unarmored instead.

entries.name: Light Footed
entries: Your base movement speed increases to 35.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, as well as in the language of your creator. Given that animated armors are often created by wizards, the exotic languages of magic such as Draconic or Primordial are commonly known.

entries.name: Flexible
entries: You can take the Dodge action as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum 1). You regain all expanded uses of this trait when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Innate Medium Armor
entries: The armor your soul inhabits is scale mail making your Armor Class 14 + your Dexterity modifier (max 2). If you use your Soul Transfer trait to transfer yourself to another piece of medium armor then the formula for calculating your Armor Class becomes that of the armor you transfer yourself to. You are also affected by any other additional properties of the armor such as a Strength requirement, a disadvantage on Stealth checks, a bonus to your Armor Class or even a curse. While you wearing armor, you may treat yourself as unarmored instead.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, as well as in the language of your creator. Given that animated armors are often created by wizards, the exotic languages of magic such as Draconic or Primordial are commonly known.

entries.name: Durable
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Heavy Footed
entries: Your base movement speed decreases to 25.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries: Your fists are as heavy as your steps. You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Innate Heavy Armor
entries: The armor your soul inhabits is chain mail making your Armor Class 16. If you use your Soul Transfer trait to transfer yourself to another piece of heavy armor then the formula for calculating your Armor Class becomes that of the armor you transfer yourself to. You are also affected by any other additional properties of the armor such as a Strength requirement, a disadvantage on Stealth checks, a bonus to your Armor Class or even a curse. While you wearing armor, you may treat yourself as unarmored instead.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, as well as in the language of your creator. Given that animated armors are often created by wizards, the exotic languages of magic such as Draconic or Primordial are commonly known.

entries.name: Age
entries: Abyssborn reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century. Despite this, most Abyssborn die young, consumed by their Abyssian heritage.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Abyssborn inherit a tendency toward chaos from their mark given to them by the Abyss, are not strongly inclined toward good. However, they aren't exlusively evil, and it's not uncommon for an Abyssborn to walk the path of good, discarding both their Abyssian heritage and their transformative powers.

{@b Humane.} Accustomed to the dark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

{@b Abyss.} Accustomed to the Abyss, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
{@b Humane.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Abyss.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet. As a bonus action, you can increase your walking speed by 5 feet for one minute.
{@b Humane.} You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception}.
{@b Abyss.} You gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}.

{@b Humane.} As a bonus action, you amplify your striking power with a shout bellowed using your Abyssborn physiology. On your next successful melee weapon attack, all creatures within 15 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC: 10 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, that creature becomes {@condition Deafened} until the end of their next turn.
{@b Abyss.} As an action, target a creature within 10 feet of you. You leap inside their soul, disappearing from the Material Plane and manifesting yourself into an invulnerable form.

While in this state, you occupy that creature's space and move with them, and are {@condition Blinded} and {@condition Incapacitated} until the start of your next turn. While tucked away inside their soul, you gain immunity to all damage types and effects, also becoming untargetable for the purposes of attacks, spells, and features.

At the start of your next turn, you leap from their body, emerging on a space within 5 feet of them and dealing {@dice {@dice {@dice 2d6}}} force damage. If no such space is available, you instead emerge on the nearest possible space. If that creature dies before the start of your next turn, the effect ends early, and you emerge on their space.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

{@b Abyss.} You suffer from a reduced cognitive state wrought from the temptations offered by your Abyssian heritage and the whispers you hear around every corner. These whispers will, over time, draw you into abject insanity. You gain a -2 penalty to your Wisdom score.

entries.name: Shard of Almorphius
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the Abyssian energy stored within your subconscious, rotting your body and wreathing it in shadows until your human visage is no more. After this transformation completes, you appear to be a demon wrought in darkness, rather than indistinguishable from a human.

Your transformation lasts for 1 hour, or until you use an action to dismiss it. The instant you transform, your racial abilities change to take on your new identity (as shown by the Humane and Abyss modifiers under each effect). If you die while in your transformative state, you body reverts to being that of a human.

You can only use your transformation twice per long rest (using an action to dismiss your transformation does not count toward this number). If the DM allows you, you can transform past this limit, receiving debuffs and losing your sanity over the course of your extended transformation. Eventually, you'll fully give in to your demonic desire, becoming consumed by the Abyss and losing all ability to reason.
{@b Humane.} You can speak, read, and write Common and Abyssal.
{@b Abyss.} You can speak Abyssal and no other languages, regardless of what languages you know.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kobolds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 120 years but rarely do so.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kobolds are fundamentally selfish, making them evil, but their reliance on the strength of their group makes them trend toward law.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kobolds are between 2 and 3 feet tall and weigh between 25 and 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Grovel, Cower, and Beg
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Imbued with magic, awakened age more slowly and typically live much longer than their unawakened counterparts. They reach adulthood after a year but can live for as long as 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Awakened will generally adopt the alignment of their owner, if they have any. Without an owner, an awakened upbringing can be radically different, as a result of the instinctual urges various breeds of awakened have. The best and worst exist among their ranks.

entries.name: Size
entries: Awakened are miniscule individuals, yet their sizes vary greatly. Cats reach just under 1 foot tall and 2 feet long from head to tail, typically weighing between 7 and 10 pounds, with larger breeds weighing up to 20 pounds. Dogs, meanwhile, are about 2 to 3 feet in height and generally weigh between 40 and 90 pounds. Regardless of your breed, your size is Tiny.

entries.name: Beastly
entries: Your creature type is beast, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: You Are an Animal
entries: Awakened don't have hands, but their arms (depending on the breed) are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks. Awakened can pick up weapons but can't use them in combat.

entries.name: Amongst Giants
entries: Tiny creatures have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, but disadvantage on Strength saving throws. In addition, tiny creatures can move into the spaces of creatures that are small or larger, provoking opportunity attacks as normal. They have a reach of 0 feet, meaning they must be in the same space as a creature to use a weapon or touch spell. This feature does not take effect if you are not currently considered Tiny.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Animal Instinct
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 and your base climbing speed increases to 30.

entries.name: Escape Artist
entries: While you are conscious, fall damage cannot knock you prone. In addition, you can use your reaction to reduce fall damage by an amount equal to 5 times your level. If this would reduce the damage of a fall greater than 20 feet to zero, you can choose to move a distance equal to half of your movement speed as part of the same reaction without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons with the finesse property, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, instead of the typical bludgeoning damage of an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Cat's Talents
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

entries.name: Pounce!
entries: As a bonus action, you can leap to a creature you can see within 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Peck & Claw
entries: You have proficiency with your claws, which are a finesse weapon that deal {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} slashing damage.

entries.name: Into the Sunset
entries: If you move at least 10 feet on foot, you can choose to gain a fly speed equal to your remaining movement. A chicken who begins to fly must end their movement on the ground or a solid surface. A chicken who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.
In addition, while falling, you can use your reaction to slow your descent as if you were under the effects of the {@spell feather fall} spell.

entries.name: Bawk!
entries: When you use your action to perform a melee attack, you can use the Help action against the target as a bonus action, as you begin to pester them with your flailing wings.

entries.name: Absurdly Paranoid
entries: You are proficient in the {@condition Perception} skill and cannot have disadvantage on Wisdom {@condition Perception} checks.

entries.name: Tale of the Headless Chicken
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can make a Wisdom saving throw against your chicken DC (12 - your Wisdom modifier) On a failed save, you fall under the {@condition frightened} condition for one turn against all enemies within a 60 foot radius, but can move toward them so long as would end your turn further away from them than before. Regardless of whether you succeed or fail this saving throw, your movement speed increases by 25 until the end of your turn. Once you use this feature. you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Bleh
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you fall into a heap of unconscious feathers and render yourself {@condition prone}. You are considered to be under similar effects to the {@spell feign death} spell. While subject to this condition, you are unable to move or take actions other than using an action to end this effect. Once you use this trait, you are unable to use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and understand Common and one language of your choice. You are unable to speak, but can communicate via a series of clucks, squawks, cackles, and similar utterances to other avian creatures. You are unable to write, but on any appropriate surface, you can create a form of writing known as chicken scratch, which can be discerned by a successful Intelligence check with the DC equal to 12 - your proficiency bonus - your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your carnivorous canines are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} + your Strength modifier, instead of the typical bludgeoning damage of an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Animal Instinct
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 40.

entries.name: Keen Nose
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill and gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

entries.name: Speak!
entries: You may use the Help action as a bonus action, for a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus. You regain the ability to use the Help action this way after finishing a short or long rest. At level 3, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than within 5 feet of you. Should the ally already have advantage, then it may add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to the attack's hit and damage roll instead.

entries.name: Who's a Good Boy?
entries: As an action, you can comfort a friendly creature within 5 feet who isn't {@condition incapacitated}. For one minute, the affected creature cannot be {@condition frightened}, and they are no longer under the effects of the {@condition frightened} condition if they were previously. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Loyal & Loved
entries: While attempting to convince a creature of something, you can choose to attack their hearts directly with the most adorable pair of puppy eyes they've ever seen. For the next minute, you gain advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks against that creature. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Dynamic Reality Check
entries: Your powerful tongue is a natural weapon with the reach property, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the typical bludgeoning damage of an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Wetlands Camouflage
entries: Your skin naturally shifts colors to reflect your surroundings. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Ew
entries: You're immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and understand Common and one language of your choice. You are unable to speak, but can communicate via a series of squeaks, tussles, kews, and similar utterances to other amphibian creatures. You are unable to write, but on any surface that can exude sound, you can create a form of writing known as morse code, which can be discerned by a successful Intelligence check with the DC equal to 12 - your proficiency bonus - your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aarakockra tend to grow up very fast, reaching adulthood at the age of 14 and living up to 70 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most aarakocra are good and rarely choose sides when it comes to law and chaos. Tribal leaders and warriors might be lawful, while explorers and adventurers might tend toward chaotic

entries.name: Size
entries: Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 40 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: Updraft
entries: Your powerful legs come segmented into two separate sections, which shift together tightly to produce a large amount of force that puts horses to shame.

As a bonus action, you can launch yourself 10-feet into the air in a single movement. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks, and you immediately begin flying with your Attuned Flight or similar feature. If you do not have a fly speed, you maintain your elevation for a few seconds, falling back to the ground at the end of your turn.
Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Peak Dwellers
entries: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to strong wind and cold environments, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide, and have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Intimidating Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any {@skill Intimidation} skill check. After using this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Talons
entries: You have proficiency with your claws, which are a finesse weapon that deal {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d6}}} slashing damage.

entries.name: Shining Wings
entries: Your wings have been sheened with a divine blessing from the Elemental Plane of Air, which you can use to reestablish your connection to your forlorn home. As a bonus action, you regain {@dice {@dice {@dice 2d4+4}}} hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra, and Auran.

entries.name: Age
entries: Centaurs mature at around the same rate as elves, but live for somewhat less time, the oldest of most being around 600 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Centaurs are inclined toward chaos, seeing no need for rules and regulations on their freedom; however, their actions still aim to be noble and just, drawing them towards good. The shy Crystalmir share these traits; the terrible Endscapes lean into evil, while Wendles are usually neither good nor evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Centaurs stand between 6 to well over 7 feet tall, with their equine bodies ranging between 4 to 5 feet at the whithers. Wendles usually sit at a smaller size of around only around 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 40 feet.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature.
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Hooves.
entries: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice {@dice {@dice 1d4}}} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Equine Build.
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Languages.
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Half human and half equestrian, centaurs are one of the noblest of races in Krynn. They have thrived for centuries in the lush, shadowy forests of Ansalon, their lifespans lasting for centuries. Their love of pleasures spawn from a hedonistic desire; thus, they are charmed by wines, foods, and music. Finer forms of entertainment are suited to most tastes; however, nature and good weather appeal to the senses just as strongly for these high-headed creatures. A Krynnish centaur is easily distinguishable from other fey minotaur by their typically deep, sonorous voices, and an antiquated yet rusting form of Common (saying things such as 'thou' and 'thy' instead of 'you' and 'your').

entries.name: Chaotic Nomads
entries: Centaurs live in loose packs and herds that have little if any codified rules and codes. These equestrian creatures rarely see a need for codes and laws, seeing such as unnecessary restrictions on their unfettered spirits. They seldom take root in the same places for long, opting to move whenever food is scarce or outsiders wander too close in numerable groups.

These Ansalonites, while they do not mind company of elves, humans, and kender, often find elves to be too serious, humans too unpredictable, and kender too childish. They often find themselves in good company with Mishta, even though they often rival a centaur's beauty in opposite, almost devilishly charming ways. Lastly, races such as minotaurs and dwarves are often seen as too ugly by centaurs, and are regarded by them often as bull-headed and stubborn.

entries.name: Beautiful Before Brutish
entries: Centaurs live for pleasure, first and foremost. Whether a new and invigorating tale to hear or tell, acquiring massive riches to flaunt and display, or even tailoring their outfit for the day: these Krynnish are obsessed with vanity. As a result, centaurs are often obsessed with their appearance and own displays of beauty. They abhor scars and disfigurement, even those from battle, and even most tattoos find their way to a centaur's disliking.

A centaur's human appearance is often still horse-like. Long hair runs down their backs like a mane. Males have broad chests, rippling muscles, and handsome, angular faces. Females are lithe and graceful, with features considered beautiful by elves and humans. Centaurs do not understand the physical modesty of other races, and wear clothing only if the weather demands it. They enjoy decorating their bodies and enhance their looks with jewelry, flowers, and other baubles. However, most baubles are often stored in a leather bag on their person, or perhaps in a hidden spot in the wilds, like a hollowed tree or an uneasily distinguished grave.

entries.name: Living in the Moment
entries: Centaurs tend to be rather passionate creatures, pursuing what they long for one minute and chasing down something else the next. Even more intellectual centaurs tend towards thinking with their heart. As a result, many centaurs switch occupations when they can or whenever they get strong urges to do so.
